problem_text:
19.9. Let G be a finitely generated linear group.
a) Is it true that the non-abelian tensor square G ⊗G is a linear group?
b) In particular, is this true for the braid group Bn for n > 3?
It is known that B3 ⊗B3 is linear, and there is a countable group G such that G ⊗G is not linear. See the definition of the non-abelian tensor square in (R. Brown, J.-L. Loday, Topology, 26, no. 3 (1987), 311–335). V. G. Bardakov, M. V. Neshchadim
